N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1157.9 - Decision-making findings

State Regulations
(a) When
the authority decides to carry out or approve an action which may have a
significant effect on the environment, the authority shall make the following
findings in a written determination: (1)

That
the authority, to the maximum extent practicable, has acted and chosen an
alternative, from among the reasonable alternatives thereto, which, consistent
with social, economic and other essential considerations of State policy, minimizes or avoids adverse environmental effects, including effects revealed
in the relevant environmental impact statement, and
(2)

Consistent with social, economic and
other essential considerations of State policy, all practicable means will be
taken in carrying out or approving the action to minimize or avoid adverse
environmental effects. (b) The authority shall file a copy of its
findings in the same manner as the DEIS is filed pursuant to subdivision (d) of
section
1157.6
of this Part. The authority
shall maintain a complete file or files of such written findings which shall be
open to the public. Notes
